intro: Samolus bracteatus, commonly known as the bracteate samolus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Samolus bracteatus is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and thrives in moist, shady environments.
